form.page_subtitle: CWC Counselling: Feeding A Healthy Child > Adding multiple micronutrient powders (MNPs)

field.name: Prepare cooked solid food such as thick porridge, mashed potato, or any soft, semi-solid, mushy-like food
Set aside a small portion of food which the child will be able to finish in a single setting
Pour entire contents of MNP sachet into the small portion of food:
Shake one sachet to ensure powder is not clumped

Do NOT add to hot food. If food is hot, your child will not be able to eat quickly enough. If food stands for a long time, the iron will change colour and taste of food, and your child might refuse to eat it
Do NOT add liquids, including water, tea, or water porridge. The iron will dissolve instantly and change colour and taste of food
Never give child tea before, during or after taking MNP. Teas inhibit iron absorption
Mix sachet contents and the small portion of food well
Give child the small portion of food to finish, and then feed child the rest of the food
Give no more than ONE full sachet per day
MNP sachet can be use at any meal
